<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 121, 636, 145]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge International AS & A Level  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 201]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NAME  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 220, 170, 250]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 214, 425, 258]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 214, 905, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 232, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
9709/41  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 245, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 Mechanics  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[710, 300, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour 15 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 270, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 480, 513]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 358, 528]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 529, 868, 560]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 485, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 605]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 856, 636]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 636, 777, 652]]<|/det|>
Where a numerical value for the acceleration due to gravity \((g)\) is needed, use \(10 \text{m} \text{s}^{- 2}\) .  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 681, 213, 696]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 697, 728, 728]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 50. The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
Two particles, of masses \(1.8\mathrm{kg}\) and \(1.2\mathrm{kg}\), are connected by a light inextensible string that passes over a fixed smooth pulley. The particles hang vertically. The system is released from rest.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 117, 801, 136]]<|/det|>
Find the magnitude of the acceleration of the particles and find the tension in the string.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 119, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 128, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[344, 83, 655, 186]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 201, 920, 235]]<|/det|>
A particle of mass \(7.5\mathrm{kg}\), starting from rest at \(A\), slides down an inclined plane \(AB\). The point \(B\) is \(12.5\) metres vertically below the level of \(A\), as shown in the diagram.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 248, 144, 266]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 247, 865, 266]]<|/det|>
Given that the plane is smooth, use an energy method to find the speed of the particle at \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 248, 920, 266]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 465, 181, 484]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 465, 920, 498]]<|/det|>
It is given instead that the plane is rough and the particle reaches \(B\) with a speed of \(8 \mathrm{m s}^{- 1}\). The plane is \(25 \mathrm{m}\) long and the constant frictional force has magnitude \(F \mathrm{N}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 510, 311, 529]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(F\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 920, 529]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[306, 81, 692, 333]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 349, 920, 386]]<|/det|>
Coplanar forces of magnitudes \(52 \text{N}, 39 \text{N}\) and \(P \text{N}\) act at a point in the directions shown in the diagram. The system is in equilibrium.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 396, 331, 415]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(P\) and \(\theta\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 397, 920, 415]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 92, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
A bus travels between two stops, \(A\) and \(B\). The bus starts from rest at \(A\) and accelerates at a constant rate of \(a \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{- 2}\) until it reaches a speed of \(16 \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{- 1}\). It then travels at this constant speed before decelerating at a constant rate of \(0.75 a \mathrm{m} \mathrm{s}^{- 2}\), coming to rest at \(B\). The total time for the journey is \(240 \mathrm{s}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 134, 146, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 134, 662, 152]]<|/det|>
Sketch the velocity-time graph for the bus's journey from \(A\) to \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 134, 920, 152]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[237, 161, 789, 299]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 355, 148, 373]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 355, 920, 388]]<|/det|>
Find an expression, in terms of \(a\), for the length of time that the bus is travelling with constant speed.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 370, 920, 388]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 586, 146, 604]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 586, 670, 604]]<|/det|>
Given that the distance from \(A\) to \(B\) is \(3000 \mathrm{m}\), find the value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 586, 920, 604]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 608, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the time from \(A\) being projected until \(C\) returns to \(O\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 920, 88]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 92, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[275, 81, 720, 225]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 237, 920, 303]]<|/det|>
A particle of mass \(1.2\mathrm{kg}\) is placed on a rough plane which is inclined at an angle \(\theta\) to the horizontal, where \(\sin \theta = \frac{7}{25}\) . The particle is kept in equilibrium by a horizontal force of magnitude \(P\) N acting in a vertical plane containing a line of greatest slope (see diagram). The coefficient of friction between the particle and the plane is 0.15 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 314, 384, 333]]<|/det|>
Find the least possible value of \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 316, 917, 333]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
A car has mass \(1200\mathrm{kg}\). When the car is travelling at a speed of \(\nu \mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\), there is a resistive force of magnitude \(k\nu \mathrm{N}\). The maximum power of the car's engine is \(92.16\mathrm{kW}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 121, 144, 140]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 121, 484, 140]]<|/det|>
The car travels along a straight level road.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 152, 180, 171]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 152, 646, 171]]<|/det|>
The car has a greatest possible constant speed of \(48\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 184, 332, 203]]<|/det|>
Show that \(k = 40\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 184, 917, 203]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 549, 223, 567]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[238, 549, 917, 567]]<|/det|>
At an instant when its speed is \(45\mathrm{m}\mathrm{s}^{- 1}\), find the greatest possible acceleration of the car. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 75, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
The car now travels at a constant speed up a hill inclined at an angle of \(\sin^{-1} 0.15\) to the horizontal.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 106, 623, 125]]<|/det|>
Find the greatest possible speed of the car going up the hill.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
A particle \(P\) moves in a straight line, passing through a point \(O\) with velocity \(4.2 \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 1}\). At time \(t\) s after \(P\) passes \(O\), the acceleration, \(a \mathrm{~m} \mathrm{~s}^{- 2}\), of \(P\) is given by \(a = 0.6t - 2.7\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 744, 140]]<|/det|>
Find the distance \(P\) travels between the times at which it is at instantaneous rest.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
